task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 183°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the roofline and ground contact clearly to estimate total height, so I will tilt the view upward while keeping the building centered.
The view is now pointed north and up, away from the target building to the south, so I should rotate back to face south while keeping the upward pitch to capture the roofline.
To estimate height I need to see the top of the facade and roof, so I will tilt up while staying centered on the building to the south.
The heading has again flipped to north; I need to face south (180°) to view the target building with the current upward pitch.
Rather than tilting up (which seems to reset heading in this interface), I should estimate from this straight-on view by counting visible floors and using a typical per-floor height.
